ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Fabrication_thickness_requirement_occurrence is a type of that characterizes the interconnect thickness range over metallic material or dielectric material and assigns a tolerance to that range for fabrication purposes.
the tolerance specifies the role of the for the Fabrication_thickness_requirement_occurrence. The tolerance is applicable over the range specified by the characterized_class_range.

the characterized_class_range specifies the role of the for the Fabrication_thickness_requirement_occurrence. The characterized_class_range specifies the set of measurements to which the tolerance applies.

the characterized_class specifies the for the Fabrication_thickness_requirement_occurrence. The characterized_class specifies either "over_finished_conductor" or "over_finished_dielectric" for the Fabrication_thickness_requirement_occurrence. This is the class to which the range and tolerance is applied.
A Layout_land_width_tolerance_requirement_occurrence is a type of that characterizes the land width range that is required to be produced for a particular terminal pitch class of mating components.

the maximum_negative_deviation specifies the largest negative allowed width deviation for the Layout_land_width_tolerance_requirement_occurrence. The deviation is measured at the surface of the that mates with the external device.
The measurement location deviates from normal fabrication practice of measuring at the base of the in order to guarantee successful assembly process.
the mating_feature_pitch_class specifies the role of the for the Layout_land_width_tolerance_requirement_occurrence.

A Pitch_class is a category in which a particular group of may fall, depending on the value of their paired spacing. The Pitch_class controls the width of the mating feature which is measured perpendicular to the primary axis of a terminal in the class. The only type permitted in the range is a .
The Pitch_class is included so that tolerances may be applied to all members of the same class, and specified only once. E.g., all pitchs with a design spacing greater than 50 mils and less than 75 mils are in the 'big' class.
Other Application Objects will be populated in order to apply the class property to tolerances of the product being designed .
the class_name specifies the name for the Pitch_class.
the class_member specifies the role of the for the Pitch_class. The range specifies the spacings which are included as a member of the Pitch_class. The shall use for the Numeric_parameter.
A Layout_line_width_tolerance_requirement_occurrence is a type of that characterizes the line width range that is expected by the design organization to be manufactured for a particular .
the maximum_positive_deviation specifies the largest positive for the Layout_line_width_tolerance_requirement_occurrence.
the maximum_negative_deviation specifies the largest negative for the Layout_line_width_tolerance_requirement_occurrence.
the tolerance_line_width_class specifies the role of the for the Layout_line_width_tolerance_requirement_occurrence.
the characterized_stratum_technology specifies the role of the for the Layout_line_width_tolerance_requirement_occurrence.

A Line_width_class is a category which assigns a name to a length range for classification purposes. The used as the basis for the range shall be a .
The Line_width_class may be exchanged so that tolerances may be applied to all members of the same class, and specified only once. E.g., all lines with a design width greater than 50 mils and less than 75 mils are in the 'big' class. All members of 'big' shall have a tolerance of +5/-5 mils. Other Application Objects must be populated in order to apply the tolerances to the class.
the class_name specifies the for the Line_width_class. The class_name specifies the name for the Line_width_class.
the class_member specifies the role of the for the Line_width_class. The shall provide length data.
